definitions.definition: a person who works in another person’s house, and cooks, cleans, etc. for them

examples.text: They treat their mother like a servant.
She was working as a servant to the Smith family.
one of the servants of the king of Persia
The duchess arrived, surrounded by her army of servants.
The relationship was one of master and servant.
They went up another set of stairs to the servants' quarters.

definitions.definition: a person who works for a company or an organization

examples.text: Mr Bennet said his client was a loyal servant to the council.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that is controlled by something

examples.text: He was willing to make himself a servant of his art.

definitions.definition: used to end a formal letter

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French, literally ‘(person) serving’, present participle (used as a noun) of servir ‘to serve’.
